greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A079500(n) - 2*A079500(n-1).
comment: Arises in studying a conjecture related to lunar divisors in base 2.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000

D. Applegate, M. LeBrun and N. J. A. Sloane, Dismal Arithmetic, arXiv:1107.1130 [math.NT], 2011. [Note: we have now changed the name from "dismal arithmetic" to "lunar arithmetic" - the old name was too depressing]
mathematica: b[n_, m_] := b[n, m] = If[n == 0, 1, If[m == 0, Sum[b[n-j, j], {j, 1, n}], Sum[b[n-j, Min[n-j, m]], {j, 1, Min[n, m]}]]];
Table[a[n], {n, 2, 48}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 15 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ in A079500 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 03 2011
